result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota J. Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Seek out, obtain and maintain full time employment

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*No contact, direct or indirect with N.C. 
*Comply with  any counseling or other treatment recommendations made by the agent.
*Required to complete an AODA, as quickly as that can be arranged after being released and ordered to comply with treatment recommendations following the assessment.

Blessinger hearing held

This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #: 15CF414

Court swears in the defendant.
Court advises defendant total warrant fine due of $788.48.

Court questions the Defendant as to his/her reasons for failing to pay and his/her financial status.
Defendant makes statement.
Court questions defendant regarding employment.
Defendant states he is employed by Degen Masonary-Waupaca.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant in contempt for failure to pay his fines as he was gainfully employed beginning in August.
Court orders the defendant to pay $50.00 to be released from jail.  Court orders a payment plan established at $100.00 per month beginning January 14, 2018, and each month
thereafter until the fines are paid in full.  If, defendant loses his job he must contact the Clerk of Courts Office.

Defendant Dakota J. Wood in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Dakota J. Wood in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:30 p.m.  Court calls the case, states the appearances. 

Court and both counsel have received the Revocation Order and Warrant Packet. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  
Serve 9 months jail on each count, concurrent. 
Huber granted. 
82 days credit. 
Pay costs that are remaining due and owing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
(copy to ADA/SPD 10-7/kp)
Atty Erik McFarland

Notice of Hearing mailed to Dakota J Wood @ 3325 Fourth Avenue, Stevens Point, WI  54481 in re:   11/20/15 Pre-Trial Conferance and 02/04/16 Plea Hearing - both returned by the post office as unable to forward, not deliverable as addressed, return to sender

Defendant Dakota J. Wood in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Dakota J. Wood in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard at this time are 15CF-38 for SAR and 15CF-414 for plea.

9:03 AM Court calls cases.
Matter of 15CF-414 is set for a plea/sentencing hearing this morning.

Atty Cousins states appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Cousins addresses the two files before the Court.
State is prepared to proceed with 15CF-38.

All parties have received the revocation packet.
State recommends 180 days on both counts with days credit.  Costs and restitution to be entered into civil judgment.

15CF-414: Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4.
Count 1 and Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
Atty Cousins states the plea agreement.

Atty McFarland concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 3 15CF-414
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 4 15CF-414

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-414 Count 1: Dismissed and Read In for purposes of sentencing
15CF-414 Count 2: Dismissed and Read In for purposes of sentencing
15CF-414 Count 3: Found Guilty
15CF-414 Count 4: Found Guilty

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court.

Atty Cousins reiterates the revocation recommended sentencing, costs and restitution are listed on the first page of the revocation packet.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-38:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, to run concurrent to Wood County Revocation
99 Days Jail Credit
Pay costs 
Pay restitution
Costs and restitution are to be converted to a civil judgment against the Defendant

*****BY THE COURT: 15CF-38: COUNT 1: NOT SUBJECT TO THIS RESENTENCING /s/RJS  2/4/16*****

15CF-38:
Count 3:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, concurrent to Count 1 and concurrent to Wood County Revocation
99 Days Jail Credit 
Pay costs
Pay restitution
Costs and restitution are to be converted to a civil judgment against the Defendant

(Listed on first page of revocation packet)
Costs are $553.34
Restitution is $3,730.62
Victim Witness is $92

Court finds joint recommendation is appropriate. 

15CF-414:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld 
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay Costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100
No Contact, direct or indirect,with N. C.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
